intro: Vochysia antioquia, commonly known as the Antioquian vochysia, is a tropical tree native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, elliptical leaves that are often pubescent. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
